mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, John Parke Custis to George Washington, 1779 December 12
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Custis, John Parke, 1754-1781
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Family business prevents his accompanying [Mrs. Washington] to camp--new plantation needs constant attention--attempt to drain the Pecoson [pocosin]--makes good meadow--recommends George Washington drain his Pecoson land at "Sheridan's Point"--it will be very advantageous to your Estate in the Neck, and will add much to the Prospect from the House ..." his ditcher will be available soon--assembly accomplishing nothing worth mentioning but local matters--Bill to incorporate city of Alexandria--ways to stabilize currency & lay taxes--to pay in lieu of mother's dower rights--depreciation of money--. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages. Docketed by George Washington.
